panels.description:
*Warning:* CPU load can be a bit of a deceiving metric

Best I can say is read the [wikipedia article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Load_(computing)#Interpretation)
panels.title: CPU Load

panels.description:
Amount *used* by the JVM

It might have requested more from the system (*commited*), but this is the amount it actually is using out of it
panels.title: RAM

panels.description: Cache size allocated, does not include metadata or other overhead, but does somewhat account for block sizes.
panels.title: Cache

panels.description: This is the mean outgoing network speed reported, by blocks of [$itvl].
panels.title: Outgoing bandwidth  [$itvl]

panels.description:
This is the number of threads the JVM is currently using

Should generally be around `50 + <requests per second>`
panels.title: Threads

panels.description:
Files currently opened

Should generally be around `100 + <images per second>`
panels.title: FDs

panels.description:
This can be seen as the "live" memory of the JVM

In a healthy situation, it should fluctuate up and down regularly (as more data is used, then old one is released)
panels.title: Heap

panels.description:
This can be seen as the memory used by the JVM for critical use

It should generally be mostly static and not vary much
panels.title: Non-heap

panels.description:
This is the percentage of time that your client spends freeing up memory, specifically when this process requires your application to completely pause.

If this is at 50%, it would mean that out of every 1 second that passes, your application is paused for 500ms of it. It should never be higher than a percent or so.
panels.title: Time lost to GC

panels.description: Total number of requests successfully served over timerange selected
panels.title: Served images

panels.description: Total bytes sent over timerange currently selected
panels.title: Sent data

panels.description:
Average cache hitrate of the current timerange

Splits timerange in blocks of [$itvl], and averages their averages
panels.title: Avg hitrate over timerange

panels.description:
This panel displays stats about upstream fetches

TTFB is the time taken by upstream to start replying

Statuses can be:
- **successful** - executed with success
- **failed** - executed but failed for some reason
- **ignored** - to avoid spamming upstream when it's dead or suffering, the client avoids calling it many times in a row if they keep failing
panels.title: Downloads from upstream [$itvl]
